definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: In the past, I had particularly loved her smell.
sentences.chinese: 过去，我特别喜爱闻她身上飘散出来的味道。

sentences.english: Lisa was riding the horse, her long hair free floating in the air.
sentences.chinese: 策马而来的正是丽莎，她的长发飘散在空中。

sentences.english: The clouds appeared, and went away.
sentences.chinese: 天上的云出现后又飘散了。

sentences.english: The song began and then in the air.
sentences.chinese: 我唱着歌，歌声飘散在风中。

sentences.english: Is still this life me walk too hurried, forget to gather together float on the scattered oath in wind.
sentences.chinese: 还是今生我走得太匆忙，忘了聚拢飘散在风中的誓言。

sentences.english: The smoke gradually scatters, flutters does not disperse is the character and style and the fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 烟渐渐飘散，飘不散的是风情和幻想。

sentences.english: In these conditions, the virus crystallizes, and can float in the air like dust.
sentences.chinese: 在这些条件下，病毒可以象灰尘一样飘散在空气中。

sentences.english: Leave a wisp of sorrow, once released into the atmosphere in the eyes.
sentences.chinese: 徒留一缕忧伤，飘散在曾经的眸中。

sentences.english: I would rather have had one breath of her hair.
sentences.chinese: 我宁可呼吸到她飘散在空气中的发香。

sentences.english: Let its ashes float away on the wind or up the vent.
sentences.chinese: 让它的灰烬飘散在通风口的风中。

sentences.english: He saw the clouds rolling away.
Allow first-come-first-served basis drum, green silk waft, we sing, dance, the sad words into flower.
sentences.chinese: 任由，青丝飘散，我们，吟风悲月，舞字成花。

definition: to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
to dissipate everywhere (of light, sound, gas etc)
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to float/to hover/also written 漂浮
